condition.name: Paralyze
condition.description: Unable to move.

condition.name: Poison
condition.description: Disadvantage on attacks and ability checks.

condition.name: Burn
condition.description: Takes fire damage over time (e.g., 1d6 damage at the start of each turn).

condition.name: Blinded
condition.description: Unable to see; any attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.

condition.name: Charmed
condition.description: The creature cannot attack the charmer and is friendly toward them.

condition.name: Deafened
condition.description: Unable to hear; disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

condition.name: Frightened
condition.description: The creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight. The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.

condition.name: Grappled
condition.description: The creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.

condition.name: Incapacitated
condition.description: The creature cannot take actions or reactions.

condition.name: Invisible
condition.description: The creature is impossible to see without the aid of magic or a special sense; other creatures are unaware of the creature's location.

condition.name: Paralyzed
condition.description: The creature is paralyzed and can't move or take actions, including reactions.

condition.name: Petrified
condition.description: The creature is turned to stone and cannot move or take actions.

condition.name: Poisoned
condition.description: The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

condition.name: Prone
condition.description: The creature is lying on the ground; it takes disadvantage on attack rolls, and attack rolls against it have advantage.

condition.name: Restrained
condition.description: The creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed. It has disadvantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws, and attack rolls against it have advantage.

condition.name: Stunned
condition.description: The creature is stunned and unable to take actions or reactions; it has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

condition.name: Unconscious
condition.description: The creature is unconscious and unaware of its surroundings; it drops anything it is holding, and attacks against it have advantage.

condition.name: Unwilling
condition.description: The creature does not want to take an action, such as making a saving throw or being compelled to move somewhere against its will.

condition.name: Blinded
condition.description: Can't see; attackers have advantage against the creature.

condition.name: Fear
condition.description: The creature must move away from the source of the fear if possible, and it has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

condition.name: Frostbite
condition.description: The creature suffers from extreme cold, taking damage and disadvantage on attack rolls.

condition.name: Marked
condition.description: Enemies who can see the creature have advantage on attack rolls against it.

condition.name: Hexed
condition.description: The creature has disadvantage on ability checks with one specific ability score.

condition.name: Marked for Death
condition.description: The creature takes extra damage from attacks, typically associated with an effect or curse.
